snippet: Claims for state unemployment benefits fell 34,000 to a seasonally adjusted 262,000 for the week ended April 25, the lowest reading since April 2000, the Labor Department said.
abstract: Labor Department reports that weekly applications for unemployment benefits fell 34,000 to seasonally adjusted 262,000, lowest reading in 15 years.
lead_paragraph: Claims for state unemployment benefits fell 34,000 to a seasonally adjusted 262,000 for the week ended April 25, the lowest reading since April 2000, the Labor Department said.

headline.main: U.S. Jobless Claims Hit 15-Year Low; Consumer Spending Rises
headline.print_headline: Jobless Claims Fall Sharply; Consumer Spending Rises
